Award.AbstractNarration: This award provides travel funding and conference registration fees for US-based undergraduate and graduate students to attend the 2014 Annual Computer Security Applications Conference (ACSAC) to be held in New Orleans, LA, on December 8-12, 2014. ACSAC is a top-tier academic security conference that regularly brings together the foremost minds in academic, governmental and commercial computer security to both address the most pressing problems in applied computer security, as well discuss seminal works in information security. The broader impact is to facilitate interaction, and to groom the next generation of security professionals.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The 30th Annual Computer Security Applications Conference (ACSAC) was held in New Orleans, LA on December 8-12, 2014. ACSAC is a top-tier academic security conference whose core mission is investigating practical solutions for computer security technology. Run by the Applied Computer Security Associates (ACSA), it brings together the foremost minds in academia, industry, and government to address the most pressing problems in applied computer security, as well as discuss seminal works in information security. The conference program is comprised of two days of tutorials and workshops, and three days of keynote talks, panels, a “works-in-progress” or WIP session, a poster session, and technical paper sessions. The conference featured a special focus on cybersecurity for cyber-physical systems.

There were 282 attendees from 26 countries, with 219 attending the general conference, and 63 attending tutorials and workshops only. The technical sessions featured 47 accepted papers out of 236 submissions, giving an acceptance rate of 19.9%. The technical sessions covered a broad range of topics, including secure builds and configuration, mobile systems security, social computing and networks, systems security, cyber physical systems, secure distributed systems, securing memory and storage, secure communications, usable security, privacy, network infrastructure security, access control and malware, software security, and web security.

ACSAC attracts many students – of the 282 attendees, 86 were students. NSF funding supported registration fees and travel costs for approximately 10 students from U.S. educational institutions. ACSA funding supported an additional 7 students from U.S. institutions and 3 students from foreign institutions. The U.S. students supported by NSF and ACSA represented the following schools:

  • Arizona State University
  • Georgia Institute of Technology (2 students)
  • Hampton University
  • Lewis University
  • Mississippi State University
  • Naval Postgraduate School
  • North Carolina State University
  • Syracuse University
  • Tulane University, School of Continuing Studies
  • University of Florida
  • University of Massachusetts (visiting from Xi’an Jiaotong University in China)
  • University of Miami
  • University of North Texas
  • University of Texas at Arlington
  • University of Texas at Dallas
  • University South Alabama

The foreign students supported by ACSA were from Hong Kong, Jamaica, and South Korea. Of the 20 students who received support to attend the conference, 2 were pursuing Bachelors degrees, 7 were pursuing Masters degrees, and 11 were in their PhD program. Many of the supported students had an active role in the conference: 9 had accepted papers, 1 presented in the WIP session, and 7 had posters in the poster session. Five of the students were women and 5 were under-represented minorities.

ACSA funding supported conference registration fees and travel costs for 4 recipients of Scholarships for Women Studying Information Security (SWSIS), which provide assistance to women studying for their Bachelors or Masters degrees in fields relating to information security. ACSA funding also paid registration fees for 12 students participating in the pre-conference TracerFIRE training class, a forensic and incident response program developed by Sandia and Los Alamos National Laboratories. All students attending the conference and/or pre-conference workshops or tutorials received discounted registration fees paid by ACSAC from general registration fees.
